EmailTemplate.subject: What’s on Your Wish List?
EmailTemplate.textOnly: It’s a magical time of year: hot chocolate, festive cocktails, and bright lights adorning neighborhoods. Restaurants around the country have brought out their patio heaters and are seeing new, as well as familiar faces as holiday travelers arrive from out of town.      This time of year also presents a few challenges for you restaurant owners and managers. We’ve got a guess or two on what’s on your wish list for this holiday season. With new strategies in place, a few tips, and a feel-good story, you’ll be ready for one of the most exciting times of the year. Marketing your restaurant during the holidays From last minute holiday shopping to reuniting with loved ones, your customers are booked and busy. But that doesn’t mean you can’t entice them to a meal or two at your restaurant. ${CTAText2} <[[${CTAURL}?${url-parameter}]]> Share on  <[[https://www.facebook.com/283156830259/posts/10160187881040260]]>  <[[https://twitter.com/NCRCorporation/status/1460261335061696515]]>   <[[https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6866027031478468608/]]> Three Things to Ask Your Technology Partner The future of technology-enabled restaurants is brighter than ever as businesses welcome back on-premises diners in a new normal. But before you can start transforming your restaurant, consider these three things to ask from your technology partner. ${CTAText2} <[[${CTAURL}?${url-parameter}]]> Customer Wins: Waffle House Waffle House, the “breakfast-all-day” chain, lost internet connection on Christmas Day last year – a potential operational disaster. They faced a loss of online orders, limited offline transactions, and potentially lost revenue-not to mention the risk of disappointing their holiday customers.
